definition: to go to work/to be present (at work, school etc)/to be away on business

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
diligent/industrious/hardworking/frequent/regular/constant
variant of 勤[qin2]/industrious/solicitous

sentences.english: Attendance will be recorded on the Training attendance register.
sentences.chinese: 出勤情况将记录在培训出勤登记薄上。

sentences.english: Attendance will be recorded on the Training attendance register.
sentences.chinese: 出勤情况将记录在培训出勤登记薄上。

sentences.english: Re-arming capacity is a significant factor in sortie generation rate.
sentences.chinese: 重新装弹能力对于出勤率而言是一个重要影响因素。

sentences.english: We find with this format, we get 80% attendance.
sentences.chinese: 我们发现通过这种形式，我们能获得80%的出勤率。

sentences.english: You can define specific plausibility checks for the entry of attendances and absences .
sentences.chinese: 你可以对输入的出勤和缺勤做特别的核对。

sentences.english: She demands that LJ check in with her on a weekly basis and maintain good grades and attendance at school.
sentences.chinese: 她要求LJ每周向她报告，保持好成绩和出勤率。

sentences.english: His attendance rate this month is desirable.
sentences.chinese: 他这个月的出勤率令人满意。

sentences.english: I do not distinguish between excused and unexcused absences.
sentences.chinese: 出勤我不区分有故和无故缺席。

sentences.english: Nonparticipation, or not being there, that will lower your participation grade.
sentences.chinese: 不参与，或是不出勤，那将会扣分。

sentences.english: As a fifth grader, he received his school's attendance award.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个小五年级，他获得了学校的出勤奖。

sentences.english: To be in charge of management and attendance record registration work to Loss Prevention casual workers.
sentences.chinese: 负责防损部临时工的管理及出勤记录工作。

sentences.english: Each group kept its own records of attendance.
sentences.chinese: 每个小组自己登记出勤情况。

definition: to be absent from work or school
full-time attendance at work
to check attendance (at school or workplace)/to monitor efficiency (of workers)
field work/field personnel/any occupation that involves a great deal of field work
to shift holidays, taking a weekday off
to leave early (before the stipulated finishing time)/to retire early (from one's job)
to take time off/to take leave (e.g. for study)/to skive off work
to take a vacation/to go on holiday
variant of 執勤|执勤[zhi2 qin2]
to work a shift/on duty
to work one's shift
to skip work/absence without leave
to act as substitute/to fill in for sb
service/duties/an orderly (military)
rush hour
shift working
